net.proteusframework.cms.controller

Class ControllerConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.cms.controller.ControllerConfiguration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean

    @Component
public final class ControllerConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean, java.io.Serializable
    The controller configuration. This class contains some basic information used by CMS controller logic. This is typically filters, servlets, and the Processor class. The URL properties become reserved words in CMS and cannot be used as URLs in the backend. If these are changed on an existing system, the database may need to be converted.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@proteus.co)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setSiteNotConfiguredURL

        public void setSiteNotConfiguredURL(java.net.URI siteNotConfiguredURL)
        Set the site not configured URL. This should be an HTML file or an URL to an HTML file.

        If the URI scheme is classpath, file, or jar, the file is read and output by CMS. Variable replacement will be done for these schemes for the variable: "$(server-name)".
        If the URI scheme is not classpath, file, or jar, then a redirect is performed. The query parameter "server-name" will be appended to the URL.
        Parameters:
        siteNotConfiguredURL - the site Not Configured URL.

      • setSupportXhtmlOuput

        public void setSupportXhtmlOuput(boolean supportXhtmlOuput)
        Set to true to support XHTML. Set to false to support tag soup.
        Parameters:
        supportXhtmlOuput - true to support xhtml.

      • setUrlParameterSeparator
